oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DEVELOPMENT OF A DEEP-LEARNING BASED WAVE FORECASTING MODEL USING LSTM NETWORK
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kyaw, Thit Oo
Shibayama, Tomoya
Shibutani, Yoko
Kotake, Yasuo
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Forecasting of wave conditions plays an essential role for offshore construction and maintenance. Recently, machine learning-based wave forecasting models have been developed and their integrated usage with physics-based numerical models has become popular. These studies mostly apply Feed Forward Neural Networks (FFNNs) with an emphasis on prediction of time-series of waves, tides and storm surges. As a particularly different approach, we develop a deep learning-based wave forecasting model using Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) network under Recurrent Neural Networks. As a case study, the model will be utilized to predict the wave conditions (low or high) near the Tottori Port, Japan.Recorded Presentation from the vICCE (YouTube Link): https://youtu.be/oMvIS9zkIOs
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 36v (2020): Proceedings of virtual Conference on Coastal Engineering, 2020; waves.31
